CatDescriptText: K. Leroy Irvis, a political activist with the National Urban League, and later as a state representative, led the fight for better employment opportunities for blacks in Pittsburgh. His poster reads "Protest! Protest!, Deliberate Tokenism in Employment is Poison To America, NAACP." He is speaking with police Assistant Superintendent Lawrence Maloney (1910-1969). In 1958, Irvis became the first African American to be elected to the Pennsylvania House of Representatives.
TitMainTitle: K. Leroy Irvis and Pittsburgh Police Assistant Superintendent Lawrence J. Maloney at NAACP demonstration against employment policies, Downtown
